Description: Limestone stela of Benaa in the form of a doorway with cavetto-cornice surmounted by a 'pyramidion' with relief representation of Anubis-jackal seated on a shrine, the cornice is marked out with palm-fronds and a sun in the horizon, adored by cynocephalous apes and human-head ba-birds, standard offering-texts are incised on the lintel and jambs; relief representation of Benaa and his wife, Inihay, shown worshipping Osiris, Isis and Nephthys with another scene showing Huy and his wife, Werner, receiving offerings from their son, Nen, and daughter, Yey; two further lines of text, containing an invocation, beneath; traces of red paint visible.
Curator's comments: Published Kitchen, Ram. Insc. Vol 3 p 205 Published: HTBM Part 9: Plate XXIII
Bibliographic references: James 1970 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 9. (Pl.23)
